body_html:
I have installed CUDA 8.0
the thing is, I want to run the code on GPU version of tensorflow

install GPU version of tensorflow & then run this code on GPU
pip install tensorflow-gpu

Create a Graph using GPU
with tf.device('/gpu:0'):
x = tf.constant([10.0, 20.0, 30.0, 40.0, 50.0, 60.0], shape=[2, 3], name ='a')
y = tf.constant([10.0, 20.0, 30.0, 40.0, 50.0, 60.0], shape=[3, 2], name ='b')

d = tf.matmul(a,b)

sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True))

print(sess.run(d))

Through exception,

then I realize let me look for GPU version if listed.

from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib

def get_available_gpus():
local_device_protos = device_lib.list_local_devices()
return [x.name for x in local_device_protos if x.device_type == 'GPU']
get_available_gpus()

body:
I have installed CUDA 8.0 
the thing is, I want to run the code on GPU version of tensorflow  

install GPU version of tensorflow & then run this code on GPU
pip install tensorflow-gpu 

Create a Graph using GPU
with tf.device('/gpu:0'):
    x = tf.constant([10.0, 20.0, 30.0, 40.0, 50.0, 60.0], shape=[2, 3], name ='a')
    y = tf.constant([10.0, 20.0, 30.0, 40.0, 50.0, 60.0], shape=[3, 2], name ='b')
    
d = tf.matmul(a,b)

sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True))

print(sess.run(d))

Through exception,

then I realize let me look for GPU version if listed. 

from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib

def get_available_gpus():
    local_device_protos = device_lib.list_local_devices()
    return [x.name for x in local_device_protos if x.device_type == 'GPU']
get_available_gpus()


![tensorflow-cpu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9411418/31124608-d0967188-a862-11e7-9cbf-588a49a01e11.PNG)
